Vocabularies.Definition: n. 情人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  On Saint Valentine's Day a gift is sent as a token（信物）of love to one's sweetheart.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (cause to) become straight or level (使)变直;(使)变平整
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She straightened the picture on the wall.

Vocabularies.Definition: go 走去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Early in the morning the hunter made his way into the woods.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. splendid in size or appearance 宏伟的;壮丽的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We had a grand view of a sea of clouds when we climbed to the top of the mountain.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. completely hold the attention of (sb.) ; take in 完全吸引住...的注意;吸收
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The writer was absorbed in his writing that he forgot to flick（轻弹）the ashes from his cigar.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 页边空白
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Some publishers make profits by printing books with wider margins and hence charging greater prices.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 笔迹;手写稿
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Your handwriting is very good.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. be a sign of, show 反映，显示
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Many newspapers reflect the opinions of the children.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. thinking about what other people need; thinking deeply 体贴的;深思的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It was very thoughtful of you to send the flowers.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 具有洞察力的 insight n. 洞察力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I learn much from my father's insightful remarks.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. happening or coming before or earlier 早先的，先前的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He has had no previous experience of this kind of job.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a person who owns sth. 所有人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The owner of a car is no longer forced to rely on public transport.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. find the exact position of ; establish in a certain place 找到…的位置;使坐落于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We located the shops as soon as we moved into the town.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. exchange letters regularly 通信
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We correspond regularly.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad., a.  to or in another country 去(在)国外(的),去(在)海外(的)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My brother lives overseas.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. (of land) able to produce good crops 肥沃的,富饶的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A large area of desert was turned to fertile soil.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. love story; love affair 爱情故事;风流韵事
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They kept the romance alive in their marriage for 35 years.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 发芽;萌芽
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Some flowers bud their leaves very early in spring.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make (sb.) worry or make (them) sad; (of ghosts) visit (a place) regularly 使担忧，使苦恼;(鬼魂)常出没于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I'm haunted with gloomy thoughts and sad memories.

Vocabularies.Definition: attempt to do sth. in spite of the possibility of failure; take a risk 碰运气;冒险
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You take a chance on the weather if you spend your holiday in the UK.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. cause a strong and often sick feeling of dislike 使厌恶,使反感
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We're all disgusted at the way her husband has treated her.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. arrange for sth. to happen or to be done at a particular time 安排;排定 n. 工作日程表，进度表
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The meeting is scheduled on Friday.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (西服上衣的)翻领
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Lapel mike（话筒）is convenient.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. support emotionally; keep (an effort, etc.) going, maintain 支持;使(努力等)持续下去，保持
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Although they had been trapped in the cave for two days, they were sustained by the knowledge that help would come soon.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. slender; small 苗条的;细小的,微小的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fashion（时装）model had a very slim figure.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 鬈发
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her hair is in curls.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. fine, well-formed; soft, tender 精美的;柔软的，娇嫩的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a delicate piece of embroidery（刺绣）.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 下巴,颏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His chin looks funny.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 挑逗的;挑衅的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a provocative speech

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  (使)弯曲
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The river curved round the hill.

Vocabularies.Definition: go in sb.'s direction 朝某人走去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I'm going your way. May I give you a ride?

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  水手，海员;航海者
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Sailors often works on a ship.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 轻声说，咕哝
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child murmured in her sleep.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (使)变成灰色
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We have grayed the wall of our room.

Vocabularies.Definition: very 很,非常
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child was more than a little excited to have Michael Jordan sign his T-shirt.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. too fat or heavy 过胖的，超重的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This parcel is overweight by two kilos.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 踝;踝节部
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The ankle connects the foot with the le.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 挤入;插入;猛推
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We thrust our way through the mass of people.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (鞋、袜等的)后跟;脚后跟,踵
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There's a hole in the heel of my stocking.

Vocabularies.Definition: (split) v. (cause to) break into two or more parts 裂开;破裂
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My trousers split when I sat down.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. (of interest, feelings, etc.) strong; deep 强烈的;热切的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Competition is very keen.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. earnest desire 渴望
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She has a longing for her son to come home.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. spend time or go somewhere with (sb.) 陪伴
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  May fair（顺的）winds companion your safe return.

Vocabularies.Definition: (upheld) vt. support 支持，维护
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I cannot uphold such conduct.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. showing or having good sense 通情达理的,理智的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  That was sensible of you.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a warm light 光亮,光辉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fire cast a warm glow on the walls.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. pause before doing sth. or making a decision 踌躇，犹豫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He hesitated before he answered because he didn't know what to say.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. take a very tight hold (of) 握紧；紧握
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child gripped its mother's arm.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (动物的) 皮，皮革
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  These shoes are made of leather.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. recognize or say who or what (sb./sth.) is 识别
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The markings are so blurred（模糊的）that it is difficult to identify.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. feeling or showing thanks to another person 感激的 be grateful to (sb.) for (sth.) 因(某事)而感激(某人)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Our grateful thanks are due to you.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (向...)行举手礼
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The soldier saluted his officer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 海军上尉;陆军中尉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  David has been a lieutenant before playing basketball.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. make or become broader (使)变宽；(使)扩大
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  For college students to do a part-time job will broaden their outlook.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 智慧；明智
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  One cannot have wisdom without living life.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. reaction ; answer 反应;回答 in response to: in answer to 作为对...的回应
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There is no response to our call for help.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 不吸引人的 attractive a. pretty; able to attract 美的; 有吸引力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Your proposal sounds unattractive.

Vocabularies.Word: Hollis Maynell 霍利斯·梅奈尔
